Hi Una,

Hope all is well.

We have updated the JA pages. https://www.veldhoencompany.com/ja/newfutureofwork/

To edit JA articles
- go to this link https://www.veldhoencompany.com/wp-admin/edit.php
- and click "japanese"

Let us know if this works for you? Cheers!

Thanks Heath,

So much going on right now, its great to get a sense check here as yes it would be too much to keep on top of.

We'll use the filters for the English speaking markets, and will use the Japanese translation for the Japanese market.

Re the Japanese landing page, could you set up the posts for us on that site? Simply copy one over from our most recent version (I can't seem to get it across) and we can clone from there.

Cheers

Una

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Hi Una, 

It essentially comes down to resourcing, each extra language on the website adds more labour and your end and ours. It also creates complexity on the site from a user navigation perspective and from a server load perspective. 

Generally we would advise against it based on the above. Simple is definitely better when it comes to content structuring, particularly when they are in the same language. The filter approach gives the user the ability to view all articles available in their language, but to also refine their search to a particular geographic region if they choose. 

I hope this makes sense?

Hi Joel, I didn't see it was you... the same sentiment applies, thank-you! ☺

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Love it - thanks Heath!

I just popped in to see if I could do it, as I was nervous about all the connections with the different languages... but I saw you added it, and I've just done the same for NL based on what you did. ☺

Any thoughts on rationalising why we wouldn't have different webpages for different countries even if they all speak English? To help me explain to the teams here

Would be great to get your experienced opinion from a web dev and customer experience point of view

Cheers

Una

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Hi Una, 

We have added the "New Future of Work" on the menu. Let me know if this works for you?

Thanks Heath - must be my misunderstanding, I do remember talking about it with you at the initial stages... maybe you recommended against it as there was no need to be so tailored? In terms of cost outlay vs what we would achieve from it? (just trying to remember so I can explain to the teams why we wouldn't go down that route)

Love the proposed filter set-up, yes please if we could have that!

How about the new tab on the menu bar for The New Future of Work? ☺

Cheers

Una

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Hi Una, 

We can serve content for a specific country that is specified on the site as a language eg. English, Dutch, Japanese. We can't however serve it based on a region such as Asia. I hope that makes sense. 

Regarding the proposed filter setup, please have a look at the attached image to see what we are recommending. If you are ok with this setup, we will go ahead and activate it.

Hi Heath
Any news on my request below?

Cheers
Una

Una Mapes
Marketing Director

Thanks Heath - I thought our site was set up to serve based on location, as we've all been under the impression we could serve different content depending on whichever country we're in... ?

Let's try the regional filter, and perhaps we won't have as much differing content. Could you help with that?

Also any chance you could help us add the 'New future of Work' tab at the top menu for us?

I'll simply add the button to the homepage too...

Cheers

Una

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Hi Una, 

Thanks for your patience waiting for our response, and for your kind words, you are very welcome. 

The site is setup to serve different content based on single languages. So, for example, it's tricky for us to serve a page to 'Asia' if that makes sense? 

What we could do, is add a 'regional' filter to the posts, so that the visitor can click, for example 'Asia' and see the posts relevant to that area (similar to the team section)? It would also enable you to publish the same posts in multiple languages (like normal). Does that work for you? 

Regarding the button, I would have it on the home page and header! This way if someone enters the site from somewhere other than the homepage, they will still see/have a way to get to this section.

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath, Joel


Hope you're both well and looking after yourselves!


I was wondering if you had any thoughts on my email below.. and if the answer is to have both? Let me know what you think.


Also, each market is requesting their own version of the landing page.
www.veldhoencompany.com/newfutureofwork


They will add their own content and use some of each other's content too.
But in summary, could you help us set up landing pages for customers in:
  • Asia (exc Japan)
  • Japan (we already have the option there)
  • North America
  • Australia, New Zealand


Let me know!


Cheers
Una




Una Mapes

Marketing Director

Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | www.veldhoencompany.com

Follow us on



From: Una McGeehan <una@veldhoencompany.com>
Date: Monday, 30 March 2020 at 3:53 pm
To: "heath@wolfiq.com.au" <heath@wolfiq.com.au>, WP Perk Support <support@wpperk.com>
Subject: Landing pages


Hi Heath, Joel

I wanted to reach out and say a HUGE Thank-you for the support you've given us in getting the landing pages live, in such a short space of time.
Your help is truly appreciated!!

We've had some good feedback so far, and people are liking the content that we're adding. And there will be more to come.

Given we started as a landing page, in reaction to firstly a press ad going out, we didn't really get the time to plan the customer journey / experience.
But now have quite a nice few posts going on within the landing pages, I wanted to ask your opinion on how best we make this available to everyone from the homepage?
  • Add a new tab with reference to 'New Future of Work' on the top menu?
  • Add a button from the homepage?
Would be great to get your thoughts on what you think would be best from a customer point of view ☺

Cheers
Una

Una Mapes

Marketing Director

Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | www.veldhoencompany.com
